abstract: Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr could complicate Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential primary strategy if he enters race and makes convincing case to minorities, particularly blacks and Hispanics, that he is rightful heir of Pres Obama; Clinton, meanwhile, has pointed to her relative strength over Sen Bernie Sanders among minorities as reason she will be more likely to prevail in general election.
lead_paragraph: Polls suggest that if Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. runs for the Democratic nomination for president, he will not begin with significant support from nonwhites.

headline.main: Biden Bid Could Lead to Battle for Minorities
headline.print_headline: Biden Bid Could Lead to Battle for Minorities

snippet: Polls suggest that if Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. runs for the Democratic nomination for president, he will not begin with significant support from nonwhites.
